content: ice-crusher beanie suitable for the coldest storms this is a super bulky knit pattern inspired by the norwegian red tapered hats that were popular as a silent form of resistance during the nazi occupation of norway 2026 unraveled handknits - ice-crusher beanie page 1 the pattern is very flexible with a four-stitch repeat it uses super bulky yarn beanie is knit in the round from the bottom up the finish includes working an i-cord an adding a tassel skill level adventurous beginner materials needles 11 us / 8mm and 13 us / 9mm - 16 round double pointed needles 13 us / 9mm for decrease and icord stitch marker scissors crochet hook or tapestry needle yarn super bulky yarn such as malabrigo rasta baah mammoth we are knitters the wool lion brand wool ease thick and quick wetq or any weight 6 yarn note my go to co for an adult size is 44 sts for rasta and mammoth and 40 sts for wetq and wak the wool approximate total yardage with 44 co = 62 - 70 yards finished size with 44 co 9 w x 10 5 h width is from the top of the brim height excludes i-cord and tassel gauge 9 stitches by 13 rounds for 4 x 4 in stockinette on us 13 / 9mm the pattern is a four-stitch repeat sizing can be adjusted by increasing or decreasing cast on by multiples of four additionally size can be adjusted by sizing up or down in needle size abbreviations k - knit p - purl st/sts - stitch es sm - stitch marker co - cast on ktbl - knit through back loop dpn - double pointed needles - number of stitches at row completion *_* - repeat stitches between parenthesis to end of round sl1yib - slip one stitch purlwise with yarn in back cdd - center double decrease detailed below cdd - this stitch reduces three stitches to one slip two sts together knitwise knit the third st then pass the two slipped sts over the knit stitch together there are many videos showing the process online 2026 unraveled handknits - ice-crusher beanie page 2 ice-crusher beanie cast on stitches for desired size adjust as needed for your yarn co of 44 is recommended for most super bulky yarn for adult beanie co 40 44 or 48 sts us 11 / 8mm connect in the round r1 *k3 p1* r2 *k1 sl1yib k1 p1* r3 *k1 k1tbl k1 p1* repeat r2 and r3 until brim is approximately 3 tall switch to us 13 / 9 mm needles r4 *k* repeat r4 until 5 5 - 6 tall decrease every odd row decreases by four stitches change to dpn when needed start the decrease at the round that corresponds to the co 48co start at d1 d1 *k21 cdd place sm* x 2 44 d2 k22 remove sm k1 replace sm k21 remove sm k1 replace sm 44co start at d3 d3 *k19 cdd
